defs: an arrogant enemy.
= ಉದ್ಧತಿಕ್ಕೆ.
haughty behaviour resulting from an unduly high opinion of oneself; exaggerated self-esteem; conceit; arrogance.
greatness or merit or stately beauty which demands proper respect.
to behave in an arrogant or overbearing manner; to be haughty.
to assume lordly airs; to ignore what is wise, decent or normal.
an arrogant woman; she who is known for her vanity.
a respectable or eminent woman.
that is lifting or raising up; that tends to raise.
that tears up by or as by the roots; tending to eradicate; exterminating.
the act or an instance of pulling or raising up.
a releasing from bondage, servitude or serfdom; emancipation.
the state of being freed from bondage, servitude, etc.
the act of or an instance of giving spiritual knowledge; enlightenment.
the state of being freed from the worldly entanglements.
a getting rid of completely; complete destruction; eradication.

a charm or an amulet that is believed to have magical powers, esp. one thought to protect the wearer from evil and to bring them good luck; a talisman.
either of a pair of punctuation marks (“ . . . ”) used to enclose a direct quotation or of single marks (` . . . ') for enclosing a quotation within a quotation; a quotation mark.
a sentence, passage etc. reproduced from a statement, book or speech, in support or as an example; a quotation; citation.
